alert.note: Alert for Bee; La Salle; Live Oak; McMullen; Webb (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued January 06 at 2:08PM CST until January 09 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS EXPECTED MONDAY... .Strong to very strong northwest winds and dry conditions expected behind a strong cold front that will move through South Texas Monday. Critical fire weather conditions will begin across the west portions of South Texas Monday and will likely spread east Tuesday. A Fire Weather Watch will likely be needed for the eastern portions of South Texas for Tuesday. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE RIO GRANDE PLAINS AND NORTHERN BRUSH COUNTRY... The National Weather Service in Corpus Christi has issued a Fire Weather Watch for low humidity and strong gusty winds, which is in effect from Monday afternoon through Tuesday afternoon. * AFFECTED AREA...La Salle, McMullen, Live Oak, Bee and Webb. * TIMING...Monday afternoon through Tuesday afternoon. * WINDS...Northwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 16 percent. * TEMPERATURES...Up to 80. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

area.areaDesc: Bee; La Salle; Live Oak; McMullen; Webb
